title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots players Garrett Bradbury, Kayshon Boutte, and Rhamondre Stevenson did not practice on Wednesday due to various injuries.
Linebacker Christian Elliss was sidelined with a hip injury; injuries could impact Patriots' strategies against 6-2 Buccaneers.
New England's offense may rely on rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams if Boutte and Stevenson remain out.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, Boston Athletic Academy coach, charged with trafficking over 10 grams of fentanyl, faces up to 20 years imprisonment.
Mejia, 31, allegedly sold fentanyl to an undercover officer on Oct. 19; pled not guilty at arraignment in Roxbury court.
Former pro baseball player Mejia, accused of working with unnamed trafficking group, released on recognizance; next court date Dec. 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group is closing its Boston headquarters and embracing a fully remote workforce, affecting offices in Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati.
The company's headquarters, previously located at 3 Center Plaza and 200 Pier 4 Blvd, has been in Boston since 2014.
Cengage now operates solely from Independence, Ky., and has integrated AI into its digital learning platforms for 90 million students globally.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 New England Patriots players went to Gillette Stadium on their off day for a workout, impressing coach Mike Vrabel.
Stefon Diggs highlighted the team's commitment and noted their focus on building their identity mid-season.
Despite a 7-2 record, Vrabel emphasizes the need to remain focused and not get complacent in the 2025 season.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead from gunshot wounds in a Beverly home.
Police discovered the bodies Monday night on Colonial Drive; the deaths are being treated as a murder-suicide.
Essex County DA, Beverly police, State Police, and Medical Examiner's Office are investigating the incident.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, linked to Whitey Bulger, sentenced to 15 years for 1984 and 1993 manslaughter cases in South Boston.
Lewis pleaded guilty to killing Brian Watson in 1984 and William Villani in 1993, avoiding first-degree murder charges.
The plea deal was reached due to risks of trial; authorities made a key break in the Watson case in 2009.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox are well-positioned to pursue Tigers ace Tarik Skubal in a potential trade, says ESPN's Buster Olney.
Skubal could command a large bid due to his impressive stats, including leading AL with a 2.21 ERA in 2025.
Boston might use assets like Jarren Duran and Marcelo Mayer in a trade, and has the funds to extend Skubal.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge temporarily blocked the installation of two patron saint statues at Quincy's new public safety building.
PETA offered financial support for the statues if a St. Francis of Assisi statue, the patron saint of animals, is added.
The ACLU filed a lawsuit in February arguing against the religious nature of the proposed statues in Quincy.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praises New England Patriots QB Drake Maye for his performance, calling it an 'outstanding year.'
Maye leads Patriots to a 7-2 record, completing 74.1% of passes with 2,285 yards and 17 touchdowns.
DraftKings ranks Maye with the third-best MVP odds, following quarterbacks Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.

title: Here’s how many people visited Salem this past Halloween
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Salem welcomed 96,000 visitors on Halloween Day, a 7.2% increase over the previous year's numbers.
October visitor numbers reached 1.1 million, matching last year's record despite rain and a government shutdown.
Total visits to Salem decreased by 6.3% compared to last year, totaling 1.4 million for the month.
